learning_objective: Refine computational models based on the data they have generated.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex has been using a mood tracking app to monitor their emotional responses to certain situations. They have noticed that they tend to feel more anxious on days when they have a lot of homework. After a couple of weeks of tracking, their raw data shows that their anxiety levels rise by 30% on high homework days. Now they are trying to build a computational model to predict their anxiety levels. They initially assumed that their anxiety levels rose by only 20% on heavy homework days. What should Alex do based on the data they have generated?",
    "Answer1": "Adjust the model to predict a 20% rise in anxiety levels on heavy homework days.",
    "Answer2": "Adjust the model to predict a 30% rise in anxiety levels on heavy homework days.",
    "Answer3": "Keep the model the same because the initial assumption was close to the real data.",
    "Answer4": "No need to adjust the model because the percentage increase can't be predicted accurately.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "While the initial assumption was close, it's important to refine data models based on actual data to improve their precision. Therefore, Alex should adjust their model so that it predicts a 30% rise in anxiety levels on high homework days."
}
